text: 14.94 The inclusion of high-quality public art into the public realm is encouraged. Proposals for public art should be durable and robust, BACK TO POLICIES positioned so as not to create street clutter and obstruct the movement of pedestrians or cyclists, and make a positive contribution to the character of the local area, including by recognising local history and cultural heritage. Developers should engage with the council at an early stage in the process to best determine what will be appropriate and how public art can be successfully integrated within a site. The council will seek to secure appropriate maintenance of public art through conditions or other legal agreements.
